result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis J Sims

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquis J Sims not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V not in court.  Attorney Jessica Bellows not in court. 

Case is set for a Competency Hearing. Doctor requests an adjournment as they are ill and unable to appear for the hearing. Email correspondence is held off of the record with both parties. Both parties agreed to a new Competency Hearing date. New date is confirmed with the doctor's office by phone.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marquis J Sims appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Marquis J Sims.  Assistant District Attorney Jessica Bellows in court for State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report was reviewed by parties.  The State is requesting a competency hearing.  The defense does not object.  This matter is adjourned in Br 45 for competency hearing.  Dr. Niese will appear in person.  mn
Competency hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Marquis J Sims appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Marquis J Sims.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Bellows in court for the State of Wisconsin.   State advised the court that victim notification needs to be addressed.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Defendant Marquis J Sims in court with attorney Joseph P Bastien.  Defendant Marquis J Sims in custody CJF.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquis J Sims appeared by video means with Attorney.   There are no challenges to the report.  
Court finds: 
-defendant incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate medication and treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offinse, whichever is less.  
Court orders:
*proceedings suspended
*Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriffs Department for transportation to the designated facility, forthwith.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:45 am via Zoom.

Attorney Joseph P Bastien in court, defendant Marquis J Sims not in court, in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per WFU request, return of doctor report rescheduled to June 30, 2022, 8:30.  kmw

-signed and filed. 
Clerk provided information to Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Marquis J Sims in Court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Marquis J Sims in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. Defendant has been NOT COMPETENT in Juvenile Delinquency matters. COURT RAISED COMPETENCY. 
Court found that there is reason to believe the Defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered Defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return, Branch 34. Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 502 of the Safety Building. 

DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
COURT TOLLED TIME LIMITS FOR PRELIMINARY HEARING.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
